Name: hard coal, import from AU | hard coal | EN15804GD, U
Category: B:Mining and quarrying/05:Mining of coal and lignite/051:Mining of hard coal/0510:Mining of hard coal
Description: The coal is transported from the mines by train to nine large coal-loading terminals at the coast of Queensland and New South Wales. An average distance of 250 km for train transport is based on data from the Australian Railway Association (BITRE, 2014). A distance of 9000 km transoceanic freight transport is estimated as average distance between the major ports for ex-/importing coal in the respective country along freight shipping routes.;Reference(s): Bureau of Infrastructure, Transport and Regional Economics (BITRE), 2014, Trainline 2, Statistical Report, Canberra ACT.
